attributes.action: Provide more justice for victims of Sexual Crimes.
attributes.additional_details: During court cases victims of sexual crimes are torn apart my defence lawyers and the whole justice system. Bullied and embarrassed in front of and entire room of people. No victim wants to be treated this way after going through what they already have. I want the government to change the way they treat victims of sexual violence and help remove the stigma around reporting it. Many people victim blame and when the courts find the accused innocent it can ruin the life of a victim.
attributes.background: Victims of sexual violence are not given enough justice. I demand that victims are treated better during the whole period of their case. I want to make sure that they are treated with more respect in court. Victims should be offered support during and after their case, regardless of the outcome.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the treatment of victims of sexual offences, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. We can also only accept petitions about things the Government and House of Commons are responsible for. Conduct in court is a matter for the judiciary, not the Government or House of Commons.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. For example, we could accept a petition calling on the Government to fund a service to support victims of sexual offences through the courts process.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Increase minimum and maximum sentences for all sexual offences: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/577443

Make the minimum penalty for all sexual offences imprisonment: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/579986

Public inquiry into the drop in prosecutions for rape and other sexual offences: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/580587
